meanings.definition: The underground part of a plant that anchors it and absorbs water and nutrients.
meanings.sent1: The rootstalk of the tree helps it stay firmly in the ground.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully examined the rootstalk of the flower before planting it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the rootstalk for a hiding spot!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the strong rootstalk of a mighty oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The rootstalk, like a straw, sucked up all the water for the thirsty plant.

meanings.definition: A horizontal stem that produces roots below and shoots above.
meanings.sent1: The rootstalk of the grass spread quickly across the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer studied the rootstalk of the potato plant to understand its growth pattern.
meanings.sent3: The rootstalk decided to take a break and grow some flowers instead!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas grew from the rootstalk of creativity within her mind.
meanings.sent5: The rootstalk, like a bridge, connected the plant to the earth and sky.
